page.title: 16WIGBER LOW EXCAVATION
page.content: In the summer of 1974 a survey of the hilltop (using a pulse induction metre) revealed a small number of anomalous readings. When the turf was removed 2 spears were uncovered. One was removed and identified by Sheffield City Museum as a{Saxon {Spear.} Later that year it was agreed with the Department of the Enviroment that a { {rescue excavation}should take place in case news of the find should leak out to treasure hunters who had been active in the area. A{grant}of Â£280 was provided for the excavations, with pay also for a director and a supervisor. More monies were later available. Three seasons work were carried out on the mound during 1975/76.
